intro: Tetragonia coronata, commonly known as the New Zealand spinach, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, edible leaves that are often used in cooking. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a trailing habit, forming dense mats on the ground. Its flowers are small and yellow, appearing in clusters, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Tetragonia coronata is well adapted to salty and windy environments, making it a hardy plant in coastal gardens.
